title: ExecutorService auto-close
summary: Use try-with-resources for automatic executor shutdown.
explanation: Since Java 19, ExecutorService implements AutoCloseable. The close() method calls shutdown() and waits for tasks to complete. No more manual try/finally shutdown patterns.

whyModernWins.title: Auto cleanup
whyModernWins.desc: Shutdown happens automatically when the block exits.

whyModernWins.title: No leaks
whyModernWins.desc: Executor always shuts down, even if exceptions occur.

whyModernWins.title: Familiar pattern
whyModernWins.desc: Same try-with-resources used for files, connections, etc.
